newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australia cuts military aid to Cambodia.
newsitem.headline: Australia cuts military aid to Cambodia.

text.p: Australian Foreign Minister Alexander Downer said on Tuesday Canberra would halt its A$2 million annual military aid to Cambodia in protest at Second Prime Minister Hun Sen's military takeover.
But cabinet had decided that general humanitarian and development aid, worth another A$32 million a year, would continue, Downer told reporters.
"At this stage, the government is continuing aid projects for humanitarian reasons," Downer said.

"The government has made clear its view that Hun Sen's overthrow of his coalition partner and first prime minister Prince (Norodom) Ranariddh by military action was completely unacceptable," said Downer, who met Cambodian ambassador Vun Chheang earlier on Tuesday.
Australia's military aid to the impoverished southeast Asian state funds communIcations and language training and maintenance of navy vessels.
Downer repeated Australia's call for a return to constitutional rule in Cambodia and for free and fair elections on schedule in 1998.
